githubAccessToken.title: Github Access Token
githubAccessToken.description: Github Access Token to store the chatbot's source code in your Github's profile (it's free).
githubAccessToken.error_message: Please enter a valid Github Access Token.
help_image: Sign up for a GitHub account https://github.com if you don't already have one.
Open this page and select 'All repositories' https://github.com/settings/personal-access-tokens/new here.
In the premissions section select: Actions, Contents, Deployments, Envirements, Secrets, Variables, Workflows
Click 'Generate Token' and copy the token to your clipboard.

OPENAI_API_KEY.title: OpenAI API Key
OPENAI_API_KEY.description: OpenAI API key for generating responses.
OPENAI_API_KEY.error_message: Please enter a valid OpenAI API key.
help_image: Sign up for a OpenAi account https://platform.openai.com if you don't already have one. Skip the onboarding process.
Open this page https://platform.openai.com/api-keys here. And create a new API key.
Copy the API key to your clipboard

YOUR_VERCEL_TOKEN.title: Your Vercel API token
help_image: Sign up for Vercel.com https://vercel.com/signup using your GitHub account.
Connect Vercel app to your GitHub account here https://github.com/apps/vercel (allow access to all repositories)
Access Tokens can be created and managed from inside your account settings.
In the upper-right corner of your dashboard, click your profile picture, then select Settings
Enter a descriptive name for the token
Choose the scope from the list of Teams in the drop-down menu. The scope ensures that only your specified Team(s) can use an Access Token
From the drop-down, select an expiration date for the Token
Once you've created an Access Token, securely store the value as it will not be shown again.
